message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public static boolean validEmails(String str_newEmails) {
    StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(str_newEmails, ",");
    while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
        String email = st.nextToken().trim();
        if (!email.matches("^[_A-Za-z0-9-\\+]+(\\.[_A-Za-z0-9-]+)*@"+ "[A-Za-z0-9-]+(\\.[A-Za-z0-9]+)*(\\.[A-Za-z]{2,})$")) {
            return false;
        }
    }
    return true;
}
<<<explanation>>>: This code uses StringTokenizer to split the input string into individual email addresses using comma as the delimiter. It then checks each email address against the regular expression to validate it. If any email address does not match the regular expression, the method returns false. If all email addresses match the regular expression, the method returns true.
